attraction_reviewComments: The many faces of Telegraph - some great little stores - and a passel of people who wish it was the 60's -look and act like it. Drive down the street - see if you want to stay...
We are Cal alumni from long ago, and appreciate that things must change. But to us, Telegraph has gotten grungier and the atmosphere far less interesting. Old used bookstores... read more
Well, I wouldn't want to be caught on Telegraph Avenue at night..but during the day it offers some incredible people watching. You have to step over the homeless, who themselves... read more
The place is full of addicts and bums. Suppose it's ok if you are one of them. There are some unique shops and restaurants but those can be found in better places.
A visit to Telegraph Avenue used to be a must for the quintessential Berkeley experience. In the last few years, however, its turned into more of a gaunlet thru homelessness... read more

Telegraph Avenue is what many an outsider assumes is "Berkeley." It's not that -- College Avenue or Shattuck Avenue (or even the northern Solano Avenue) are probably better bets... read more
Many places around the world have a Telegraph Ave.......this one is reminiscent of a certain era, that's all.
The heart of the counterculture/hipster/student shopping scene butted up against the campus. It has seen better days, but there are usually some artisans selling jewelry, etc. to... read more
This area has a lot of great stores and restaurants, but it's full of weird, creepy people. If you don't mind those weird people, this is a great place to check out!
What's not to like in this college town? Lots of great eats and a bold expression of the city's liberalism.
Like time traveling back to a slightly updated version of the 1960's. Crowded, can I say unique to wrap it up. If you have never been, it's a must, then you decide if you... read more
A few good shops remain, mostly junk. It has little of the character it once did. Moe's Books is a big exception.
